CatDescriptText: Mrs. C. Hutchinson, 1432 Fifth Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think children should be given 'allowances' (money)? If so, for what reason or reasons (just to have spending money or for chores done around the home, etc.)?  Do you think that it helps or hinders the development of the youngster?" answer reads: "I really do.  It keeps them from begging and getting into trouble when they see that the other children have money and they do not have any.  They should cut the grass or do other chores."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. C. Hutchinson wearing striped short sleeved dress with light colored buttons, dark belt, and eyeglasses, holding paper bags and standing in front of store with advertisement in window reading "Your Best Buy! If these folks can't make the best paint, who can?"
